pageTitle: Itinerary for Wednesday, November 9, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Wednesday, November 9, 2016:

Ottawa, Ontario

10:05 a.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks at the WE Day celebration.

Canadian Tire Centre
1000 Palladium Drive
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media registration opens at 8:30 a.m. All media hoping to capture the Prime Minister’s address should arrive by 9:00 a.m. at the latest. Note that access to media filming and photography locations are on a first come first served basis.
  • Media should enter through Dodge Gate for registration (look for directional signage).
  • As use of wireless equipment is not permitted in venue, audio boards will be provided for ENGs to plug in to.
  • For media outlets looking to air live from WE Day, there are seven (7) Ethernet cables available to plug in to, available on a first come first served basis. Please contact Camila Ossa from the WE Day PR team immediately to reserve a line (contact details below)
  • Contact information for media inquiries:  Camila Ossa, Associate Director, Public Relations, WE Day 1-416-885-5522 or camila.ossa@we.org
  • The Prime Minister’s speech will be streamed through Facebook Live on WE’s Facebook page


11:00 a.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will cast their ballots in the provincial by-election in the riding of Ottawa-Vanier.

Returning Office
214 Montreal Road, Suite 500
Ottawa, Ontario

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity only for arrival at Returning Office


PMO Media Relations:
media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca
613-957-5555
